page.title: 12Historical Interest
page.content:
Hallyard Palace On the N.W. perimeter of Auchtertool there can be found the ruins of Hallyard Palace. Built in the 11th Century as a hunting seat for King Malcolm Canmore,(1057-99) his son David 1st gave Hallyard to the newly erected Bishopric of Dunkeld in 1127. Successive Bishops used the Palace as one of their chief residences.
In 1526, the Palace and lands were given to Sir James Kirkcaldy, counsellor to James the 5th. Shortly after James the 5th was defeated at the Battle of Solway Moss, he spent the night at Hallyard's before going on to Falkland Palace and his death. The Kirkcaldy's were staunch supporters of the Protestant cause and were believed to be implicated in the death of Cardinal Beaton in 1546(cont)
